intro: Pilocarpus amarus, commonly known as the Amazonian prickly ash, is a deciduous shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are a source of food for various wildlife species. Pilocarpus amarus is also valued for its medicinal properties, with its leaves containing compounds used in traditional medicine. Its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils makes it an important component of the rainforest ecosystem.
